intro: Thlaspi ochranthum, commonly known as the yellow cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows, riverbanks, and disturbed areas. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Thlaspi ochranthum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in challenging environments.
